claims.text: AI has the potential to make tremendous changes. It's going to create huge numbers of new jobs that we can't even imagine what they are today. It will change the nature of what people do every day… And it will take some jobs away.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: Davos 2026 interview discussing AI's broad societal impact
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Frames AI as epochal transformation affecting all work, legitimizing major workforce changes
claims.notes: Utopian framing - 'tremendous changes', 'huge numbers of new jobs we can't even imagine'

claims.text: I want to stack the odds that we will help our people reinvent themselves.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: Explaining rationale for mandatory AI training for 175,000 employees
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Positions workforce training as moral obligation to employees, not just efficiency move
claims.notes: Higher-calling - obligation to help employees adapt, not merely extract productivity

claims.text: Our people should be as much in the driving seat as possible.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: Explaining workforce empowerment philosophy behind AI training mandate
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines organizational identity as employee-empowering rather than top-down
claims.notes: Identity claim - who we are as an organization that empowers workers

claims.text: We're encouraging our people saying, 'Not that AI is going to take your job away, but someone using AI is going to probably be better at your job than you are.' So, how do we equip you to use [AI tools]?
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: Explaining competitive rationale for AI training to employees
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Creates urgency through competitive threat framing - adapt or be outcompeted
claims.notes: Survival framing - someone using AI will outcompete you

claims.text: We are committed to becoming one of the industry's first truly AI-ready workforces, and we are well on our way.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Stakes out aspirational identity as AI leader, creates competitive positioning
claims.notes: Identity claim - who we are becoming (AI-ready workforce)

claims.text: We are not at the end of a cycle — we are at the start of something transformational. This is not a passing phase, it's a permanent shift in global dynamics.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: 2025 Annual Stockholders' Meeting remarks on transformation
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Frames current moment as epochal turning point requiring fundamental change
claims.notes: Utopian framing - 'permanent shift in global dynamics', start of transformation

claims.text: It has the potential to revolutionize all functions across our bank and the industry — changing how we write code, onboard clients, service customers, detect fraud, develop market research and strengthen compliance and controls.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: LinkedIn article on generative AI strategy
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines specific operational outcomes AI will achieve across all functions
claims.notes: Teleological - specific achievable outcomes across functions

claims.text: Finding your unique and attainable AI 'why' is critical. At Citi, our work in generative AI is guided by our commitment to transforming and strengthening Citi.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: LinkedIn article explaining Citi's strategic AI approach
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Anchors AI adoption in organizational identity and transformation purpose
claims.notes: Identity claim - our unique 'why', guided by commitment to transformation

claims.text: Overall, the risks of not embracing generative AI far outweigh the risks of engaging with it.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: LinkedIn article on responsible AI adoption
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Creates urgency through risk framing - inaction is more dangerous than action
claims.notes: Survival - risks of not embracing outweigh risks of engaging

claims.text: Citi will always be a human bank, and AI can and will help amplify the power of our people.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Defines core identity as human-centered, AI as amplifier not replacement
claims.notes: Identity + higher-calling - 'always be a human bank', amplify people

claims.text: We are not graded on effort. We are judged on our results.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: Internal memo titled 'The bar is raised' to 200,000+ employees
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Sets performance expectations tied to AI-enabled productivity gains

claims.text: Over time, we can expect automation, AI and further process simplification to reshape how work gets done — some roles will change, new ones will emerge and others will no longer be required.
claims.speaker: Jane Fraser
claims.context: Internal memo on workforce transformation expectations
claims.rhetoricalFunction: Prepares workforce for fundamental role changes, normalizes displacement
claims.notes: Utopian framing of epochal change + survival undertones
